primary.$description: The primary brand color also used as the primary accent color. [brand; accent; primary; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

secondary.$description: The secondary brand color. If your color system has only one brand color, using this token is optional. [brand; accent; secondary; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

default.$description: The default background color of the page, typically applied to the html or body element. This token should only be used as empty space surrounding/behind content or regions in Mastercard applications. We do not recommend placing components or content directly on background.default as they may not provide sufficient contrast in light theme (use the surface colors instead). [body; html; canvas; page; fill; solid; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

disabled.$description: The background color of the elements in a disabled state. [disabled; inactive; fill; solid; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

backdrop.$description: The background color for temporary overlays that can be applied to Unify surfaces for the purpose of making content on a surface less prominent. Typically used with Modals, Drawer and Sheet components. [overlay; backdrop; modal background; scrim; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

default.$description: The background color of any surface elements in the UI. Typically applied to Containers, Sections, Content Cards, or any other container/component that contains UI elements and other components. [surface; default; primary; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

secondary.$description: The secondary surface color, typically applied to the backgrounds of content cards, sections, and similar components. [surface; secondary; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

hover.$description: The hover state color for the color.background.surface.default token. It should be used as the background color for the hover state of elements like dropdown list items, interactive cards, and more. [surface; hover; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

transparent.$description: This token represents the absence of a surface background color, ensuring no background color is applied. It can be used to override the default or secondary surface background colors. [surface; transparent; none; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

selected.$description: The selected state color for the color.background.surface.default token. [surface; selected; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

selected-hover.$description: The selected hover state color for the color.background.surface.default token. [surface; selected hover; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

inverse.$description: An inverted variant of the default surface color, dark in light mode and light in dark mode. It is used as the background color for components such as tooltips. [surface; inverse; inverted; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

secondary-hover.$description: The hover state color for the color.background.surface.secondary token. [surface; secondary; hover; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

default.$description: The background color for elements that reinforce the brand. This color can be used as the background for sections, buttons, and other interactive elements. [brand; accent; primary; default; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

hover.$description: The hover state color for the color.background.brand.primary.default token. [brand; accent; primary; hover; mouse over; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

active.$description: The active state color for the color.background.brand.primary.default token. [brand; accent; primary; active; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

default.$description: The secondary brand background color. It can be used as a complementary color to the primary brand background color. [brand; accent; secondary; default; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

hover.$description: The hover state color for the color.background.brand.secondary.default token. [brand; accent; secondary; hover; mouse over; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

active.$description: The active state color for the color.background.brand.secondary.default token. [brand; accent; secondary; active; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

active.$description: The active state color for the color.background.feedback.discovery.default token. [discovery; positive; alert; notification; purple; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

default.$description: A stronger-emphasis variant of the color.background.feedback.discovery.default token, used to indicate a change or something new. [discovery; positive; alert; notification; purple; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

hover.$description: The hover state color for the color.background.feedback.discovery.strong.default token. [discovery; positive; alert; notification; purple; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

active.$description: The active state color for the color.background.feedback.discovery.strong.default token. [discovery; positive; alert; notification; purple; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

default.$description: The background color for the default state of elements indicating important information or something in progress. [information; positive; alert; notification; blue; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

hover.$description: The hover state color for the color.background.feedback.information.default token. [information; positive; alert; notification; blue; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

active.$description: The active state color for the color.background.feedback.information.default token. [information; positive; alert; notification; blue; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

default.$description: A stronger-emphasis variant of the color.background.feedback.information.strong.default token, used to indicate important information or something in progress. [information; positive; alert; notification; blue; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

active.$description: The active state color for the color.background.feedback.information.strong.default token. [information; positive; alert; notification; blue; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

default.$description: The background color for the default state of elements indicating neutral feedback. [neutral; subtle; muted; monochrome; positive; alert; notification; gray; grey;]

hover.$description: The hover state color for the color.background.feedback.neutral.default token. [neutral; subtle; muted; monochrome; positive; alert; notification; gray; grey; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

active.$description: The active state color for the color.background.feedback.neutral.default token. [neutral; subtle; muted; monochrome; positive; alert; notification; gray; grey; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

default.$description: A stronger-emphasis variant of the color.background.feedback.neutral.default token, used to indicate neutral feedback. [neutral; subtle; muted; monochrome; positive; alert; notification; gray; grey; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

hover.$description: The hover state color for the color.background.feedback.neutral.strong.default token. [neutral; subtle; muted; monochrome; positive; alert; notification; gray; grey; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

active.$description: The active state color for the color.background.feedback.neutral.strong.default token. [neutral; subtle; muted; monochrome; positive; alert; notification; gray; grey; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

default.$description: The background color for the default state of input components, such as form fields, dropdowns, multiselect, and combobox. [input; field; dropdown; multiselect; combobox; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

brand.$description: The border color that represents the brand’s primary color. [brand; accent; border; outline; stroke; divider; separator; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

default.$description: The default border color for such elements as containers, cards, sections, dividers, table cells, etc. [border; outline; stroke; divider; separator; default; subtle; outline; gray; grey; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

strongest.$description: The color for the most prominent and highly emphasized borders. It is ideal for framing highly important content. Use this token sparingly to maintain visual balance and impact. [border; outline; stroke; divider; separator; bold; high contrast; gray; grey; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

strong.$description: The color for prominent or heavily emphasized borders. Use this token for elements requiring standout borders to enhance accessibility or clarity. [border; outline; stroke; divider; separator; strong; higher contrast; gray; grey; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

neutral.$description: The color for borders that are subtle and non-intrusive, typically used for providing structure without drawing attention. It works well for secondary elements. [border; outline; stroke; divider; separator; neutral; gray; grey; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

focused.$description: The color of the stroke for elements in a focused state, such as form inputs or buttons. This token helps visually highlight and indicate to users which element is currently being interacted with, improving accessibility and user experience. [border; outline; stroke; focus; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

disabled.$description: The border color for elements in a disabled state, such as form fields that are disabled or inactive. [border; outline; stroke; disabled; inactive; non-interactive; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

input.$description: The border color for the form UI elements, such as form fields, checkboxes, radio buttons, etc. [border; outline; stroke; input; checkbox; radio; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

success.$description: The color for borders that indicate a successful or positive state. Use it for components like alerts and badges or in areas where success should be communicated subtly with low contrast. [border; outline; stroke; success; positive; feedback; green; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

success-strong.$description: The color for borders that indicate a successful or positive state, such as validated inputs or completed actions. Use it for form fields, status indicators, or other components where success needs to be clearly conveyed. [border; outline; stroke; success; positive; feedback; green; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

danger.$description: The color for borders that indicate an error, danger, invalid state, or destructive action. Use it for components like alerts and badges or in areas where errors should be communicated subtly with low contrast. [border; outline; stroke; danger; error; feedback; red; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

danger-strong.$description: The color for borders that indicate an error or invalid state, or a destructive action, such as failed form validation or error messages. Use it for form fields, status indicators, or components where errors needs to be clearly conveyed. [border; outline; stroke; danger; error; feedback; red; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

warning.$description: The color for borders that indicate a warning or caution. Use it for components like alerts and badges or in areas where warnings need to be communicated subtly with low contrast. [border; outline; stroke; warning; caution; feedback; yellow; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

warning-strong.$description: The color for borders that indicate a warning or caution. Use it for components like alerts and badges or in areas where warnings need to be clearly conveyed. [border; outline; stroke; warning; caution; feedback; yellow; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

information.$description: The color for borders that indicate information, something in progress, or a non-destructive action. Use it for components like alerts and badges or in areas where information should be communicated subtly with low contrast. [border; outline; stroke; information; feedback; blue; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

information-strong.$description: The color for borders that indicate information, something in progress, or a non-destructive action. Use it for components like alerts and badges or in areas where information need to be clearly conveyed. [border; outline; stroke; information; feedback; blue; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

discovery.$description: The color for borders that indicate change or something new. Use it for components like alerts and badges or in areas where new information should be communicated subtly with low contrast. [border; outline; stroke; discovery; feedback; purple; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

discovery-strong.$description: The color for borders that indicate change or something new. Use it for components like alerts and badges or in areas where new information need to be clearly conveyed. [border; outline; stroke; discovery; feedback; purple; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

inverse.$description: The color for borders used on dark or inverted backgrounds, ensuring sufficient contrast for visibility. [border; outline; stroke; inverse; inverted; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

neutral-strong.$description: A stronger emphasis option of the color.border.neutral token. [border; outline; stroke; divider; separator; strong; dark; gray; grey; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

none.$description: This token represents the absence of a border, ensuring no visible outline or separation is applied. It can be used to explicitly override default border styles or when a clean, borderless appearance is required. [borderless; transparent; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

disabled.$description: The disabled state color for icons. [icon; pictogram; svg; disabled; inactive; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

helper.$description: The color for monochrome helper-type icons. [icon; pictogram; svg; helper; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

neutral.$description: The tertiary color for icons, intended for use on backgrounds of neutral variant components. [icon; pictogram; svg; neutral; tertiary; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

on-color.$description: The color for icons used on brand, interactive, or strong feedback color backgrounds, ensuring sufficient contrast for visibility. [icon; pictogram; svg; inverse; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

success.$description: The success state color for icons. [icon; pictogram; svg; success; positive; feedback; green; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

danger.$description: The danger or error state color for icons. [icon; pictogram; svg; danger; negative; error; destructive; feedback; red; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

warning.$description: The warning state color for icons. [icon; pictogram; svg; warning; caution; feedback; yellow; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

information.$description: The information type color for icons. [icon; pictogram; svg; information; feedback; blue; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

discovery.$description: The discovery type color for icons. [icon; pictogram; svg; discovery; feedback; purple; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

brand.$description: The color for branded text, often used for interactive text. [text; copy; content; heading; header; body; brand; accent; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

secondary.$description: The secondary color for text, used for non-interactive text. [text; copy; content; secondary; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

inverse.$description: The color for text used on dark or inverted backgrounds, ensuring sufficient contrast for visibility. [text; copy; content; inverse; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

disabled.$description: The color for disabled state text. [text; copy; content; disabled; inactive; read-only; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

placeholder.$description: The color for placeholder text, used in text input components. [text; placeholder; input; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

helper.$description: The tertiary color for text, used for non-interactive text. [text; copy; content; helper; tertiary; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

neutral.$description: The quaternary color for text, used for non-interactive text. [text; copy; content; neutral; quaternary; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

selection-bg.$description: The background color applied to selected text. [selection background; highlighted text background; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

on-color.$description: The color for text used on brand, interactive, or strong feedback color backgrounds, ensuring sufficient contrast for visibility. [text; copy; content; semantic; role; decision; alias;]

success.$description: The success state color for text. [text; success; positive; feedback; green; semantic; role; decision; alias;]
